arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Bayer Leverkusen; Former Bayern target headed to LAFC?; João Félix to stick with AC Milan?; Manchester City to make play for Real Madrid’s Jude Bellingham?; and MORE!
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen only securing a point could be a death knell for its Bundesliga title hopes, though with the way that Bayern Munich has been playing of late, it could get dicey for the Bavarians. Bayern Munich traveled to Bayer Leverkusen with the mission of not losing the match.

arts.ttl: Historical collapse: Bayern’s first no-shot game in years
arts.sum: Leverkusen’s defensive organization and Bayern’s completely disconnected attack pushed Die Rekordmeister to a performance as shambolic as this one. Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Jamal Musiala wants to look at the positives from 0-0 draw against Bayerrn Leverkusen
arts.sum: Looking for more thoughts and analysis on Bayern Munich’s frustrating 0-0 draw with Bayer Leverkusen? Leverkusen controlled possession, dictated tempo, and somehow got Bayern to have an xG of less than zero.

arts.ttl: Manuel Neuer reacts to Bayern’s shambolic performance against Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Bayern Munich ’s 0-0 draw against Bayer Leverkusen was anything but classy, and all of Bayern’s squad had to agree. Looking for more thoughts and analysis on Bayern Munich’s frustrating 0-0 draw with Bayer Leverkusen?

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Jamal Musiala showers praise on Florian Wirtz after 0-0 draw with Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Bayern Munich ’s Jamal Musiala revealed how tough of an opponent Florian Wirtz can be. The Bavarians had a mediocre night against Bayern Leverkusen.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show: Bayer Leverkusen 0-0 Bayern Munich (Bundesliga)
arts.sum: Bayern Munich came away with a performance they would like to forget quickly in a 0-0 draw against Leverkusen. Bayern Munich produced a performance to forget against Bayer Leverkusen.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen efforts tame Bayern Munich attack to previously unseen levels
arts.sum: Xabi Alonso's defending Bundesliga champions may not have been able to pick up maximum points in their crucial encounter against league leaders Bayern Munich, but Bayer 04 did manage to push their opponents towards an unwanted record in the teams' latest meeting. Ultimately, Leverkusen will be disappointed not have cut the gap to league-leaders Bayern as they instead remain eight points adrift with 12 games remaining, but the Werkself will take heart from the way they restricted the Bundesliga's highest goalscorers this term.

arts.ttl: Leverkusen-Bayern tactical analysis: Xabi Alonso cracks Bayern code again in 0-0 draw
arts.sum: Bundesliga fans and German “tactic heads” looked forward to this match with great anticipation, and it turned out to be an intense tactical affair indeed. Defending Bundesliga champions Bayer 04…

arts.ttl: Leverkusen's Alonso admits 'mixed feelings' after a tactical clinic with no goals against Bayern
arts.sum: I think that the way we have played, it’s been our best game against Bayern this year, probably even last year,” Alonso said. Alonso remained unbeaten in six games as a coach against Bayern in all competitions.

arts.ttl: Four Observations following Bayern Munich’s 0-0 draw to Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen and Bayern Munich, the two best teams in Germany, were set to decide the fate of a title race that could’ve been over by mid-February. Leverkusen dominated the first 25 minutes, winning the ball countless times in Bayern’s half as the Bavarians struggled to build from the back.
